meta.description: Choose your hunting style: Stalk creatures wait patiently, building power before striking from the shadows. Pride hunters coordinate attacks for devastating combined damage. Pursuit hunters use speed to overwhelm.

cards._comment: === AMBUSH SPECIALISTS (Stalk archetype) - Patient solo hunters ===
cards.name: Sand Cat
cards.flavorText: Sand cats survive without drinking water, getting all moisture from their prey.

cards.name: Black-Footed Cat
cards.flavorText: At 2.4 lbs, the black-footed cat has a 60% kill rate ‚Äî the highest of any wild cat.

cards.name: Pallas's Cat
cards.flavorText: Pallas's cats have round pupils, unique among small cats, adapted to low-light steppe hunting.

cards.name: Jungle Cat
cards.flavorText: Jungle cats were semi-domesticated by ancient Egyptians and mummified alongside their owners.

cards.name: African Wildcat
cards.flavorText: DNA confirms the African wildcat is the sole ancestor of all 600 million domestic cats.

cards.name: European Wildcat
cards.flavorText: European wildcats are 25% larger than domestic cats, with a distinctive blunt-tipped bushy tail.

cards.name: Rusty-Spotted Cat
cards.flavorText: Weighing just 2 lbs, the rusty-spotted cat is the world's smallest wild felid.

cards.name: Fishing Cat
cards.flavorText: Fishing cats have partially webbed feet and dive headfirst to catch fish underwater.

cards._comment: === PURSUIT SPECIALISTS (Speed archetype) - Fast aggro hunters ===
cards.name: Serval
cards.flavorText: Servals catch prey with a 62% pounce success rate, leaping up to 10 feet vertically.

cards.name: Caracal
cards.flavorText: Caracals can swat multiple birds from a flock mid-flight using oversized hind legs.

cards.name: African Golden Cat
cards.flavorText: African golden cats shift color from red to grey over their lifetime. No one knows why.

cards.name: Asian Golden Cat
cards.flavorText: Asian golden cats can take down prey three times their size, including water buffalo calves.

cards.name: Jaguarundi
cards.flavorText: Jaguarundis are diurnal, unlike most wild cats, and have been seen foraging alongside monkeys.

cards.name: Geoffroy's Cat
cards.flavorText: Geoffroy's cats are strong swimmers and one of the few felids that hunt in water regularly.

cards.name: Pampas Cat
cards.flavorText: Pampas cats thrive from sea level to 16,000 ft, one of the widest altitude ranges of any cat.

cards.name: Bay Cat
cards.flavorText: The Borneo bay cat went unphoto¬≠graphed until 2003 ‚Äî one of Earth's least-known felids.

cards._comment: === PRIDE HUNTERS (Coordinated Hunt archetype) - Pack tactics ===
cards.name: Lioness
cards.flavorText: Lionesses do 85-90% of the pride's hunting, using coordinated flanking strategies.

cards.name: Young Lion
cards.flavorText: Young male lions are expelled from the pride at age 2-3 and must form nomadic coalitions.

cards.name: Lion Cub
cards.flavorText: Lion cubs are born blind and weigh just 3 lbs. Females synchronize births to nurse communally.

cards.name: Asiatic Lioness
cards.flavorText: Fewer than 700 Asiatic lions survive, all in India's Gir Forest ‚Äî one disease could end them.

cards.name: White Lion
cards.flavorText: White lions carry a recessive leucism gene ‚Äî not albinism. Their eyes remain normal color.

cards.name: Barbary Lioness
cards.flavorText: Barbary lions had the largest manes of any subspecies, extending down the belly and chest.

cards.name: Cave Lioness
cards.flavorText: Cave lions were 25% larger than modern lions and hunted mammoths across Ice Age Europe.

cards.name: Tsavo Lioness
cards.flavorText: Tsavo male lions are maneless ‚Äî likely an adaptation to the region's extreme heat.

cards.name: Bengal Tiger
cards.flavorText: Bengal tigers in the Sundarbans are the only big cats that routinely swim between islands to hunt.

cards.name: Jaguar
cards.flavorText: Jaguars have the strongest bite of any big cat ‚Äî 1,500 PSI, enough to pierce turtle shells.

cards.name: Snow Leopard
cards.flavorText: Snow leopards use their 3-foot-long tails as blankets, wrapping them around their face while sleeping.

cards.name: Clouded Leopard
cards.flavorText: Clouded leopards can climb headfirst down trees thanks to rotating ankle joints unique among cats.

cards.name: Cheetah
cards.flavorText: Cheetahs accelerate 0 to 60 mph in 3 seconds but overheat after just 30 seconds of sprinting.

cards.name: Cougar
cards.flavorText: Cougars hold the Guinness record for most names: puma, mountain lion, catamount, and 40+ others.

cards.name: Eurasian Lynx
cards.flavorText: Eurasian lynx ear tufts act as antennas, enhancing hearing to detect prey under deep snow.

cards.name: Iberian Lynx
cards.flavorText: The Iberian lynx dropped to 94 individuals in 2002. Conservation brought them back past 2,000.

cards.name: African Lion
cards.flavorText: A lion's roar reaches 114 decibels and can be heard 5 miles away across the savanna.

cards.name: Barbary Lion
cards.flavorText: Barbary lions weighed up to 600 lbs ‚Äî the largest lion subspecies ever recorded.

cards.name: Pride Matriarch
cards.flavorText: The oldest female leads pride hunts, choosing formation and timing based on decades of experience.

cards.name: King of Beasts
cards.flavorText: Male lions sleep up to 20 hours a day, conserving energy for territorial fights that decide everything.

cards.name: Ambush from Cover
cards.flavorText: A cat's fur pattern breaks up its outline ‚Äî natural camouflage called disruptive coloration.

cards.name: Swift Chase
cards.flavorText: Cats use a rotary gallop at top speed ‚Äî the same gait as racehorses, with all four feet airborne.

cards.name: Pride Rally
cards.flavorText: Lions are the only social cats. Prides coordinate hunts with assigned roles like flankers and drivers.

cards.name: Territorial Roar
cards.flavorText: Tigers scent-mark territories up to 400 sq miles. The smell alone deters most rivals.

cards.name: Apex Strike
cards.flavorText: A tiger's paw swipe delivers roughly 10,000 lbs of force ‚Äî enough to shatter a bear's skull.

cards.name: Primal Roar
cards.flavorText: Big cats roar thanks to a flexible hyoid bone. Small cats purr instead ‚Äî none can do both.

cards.name: Quick Pounce
cards.flavorText: Cats can go from resting to full sprint in a single bound using fast-twitch muscle fibers.

params.title: Choose a creature to grant Haste

cards.name: Feline Grace
cards.flavorText: Cats' righting reflex lets them twist mid-air in 0.3 seconds to land feet-first from any height.

cards.name: Night Eyes
cards.flavorText: Cat eyes have a reflective tapetum lucidum layer, giving them 6x better night vision than humans.

params.title: Choose a creature to grant Acuity

cards.name: Primal Instinct
cards.flavorText: A cat's whiskers detect air vibrations, letting them sense prey movement in total darkness.

cards.name: Hidden in the Grass
cards.flavorText: Cats can flatten their ears and compress their body to hide in grass just 6 inches tall.

cards.name: From the Trees
cards.flavorText: Leopards cache kills in trees up to 50 feet high, safe from hyenas and lions below.

cards.name: Coordinated Ambush
cards.flavorText: Lionesses split into wings during group hunts ‚Äî one flushes prey, the other cuts off escape.

cards.name: Patient Hunter
cards.flavorText: Cats blink less than almost any mammal ‚Äî they can stare motionless for over 30 minutes straight.

params.title: Choose a creature to enter stalking mode
